reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: The Balboa Park Inn was a terrific find for us. Because we have an infant, we needed to have separate spaces for sleeping & gathering -- the Mayfair Suite MORE than met this need with its large living room and two bedrooms. The full kitchen was also a terrific asset as we didn't want to pack up and leave the hotel for every meal. We even prepared a meal and then ate out in the courtyard one evening -- it was quite peaceful.
reviews.title: Great for Travel with Family & Friends

likes.liked: — Space. Basically like our own mini-apartment.
likes.disliked: — fake flowers & bought-in breakfast pastries -- although fresh & homemade would make the room cost more.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location was ideal for meeting friends with small kids -- just a short walk to the zoo. When we were up for a longer stroll, the rest of Balboa Park had tons to offer -- museums, shops, picnic areas, and the ever-essential: playground. The hotel is also only a short drive from a number of restaurants and grocery stores -- not too far from I-5 (main interstate thorough-fare) -- and only 12 minutes from the airport.
reviews.title: Best find in San Diego

likes.liked: — Attention to detail, quiet, homey, great staff,great location

reviews.title: Service out of this world!
reviews.text: The staff was extremely courteous and helpful, even altering the cleaning schedule to work around the baby's nap time.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: Overall, we had a great experience with the Balboa Park Inn.
reviews.title: Great place to stay in San Diego

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Best decision we made was booking the Balboa Park Inn. The service was friendly, helpful, knowledgable and outstanding in every sense.
reviews.title: Adorable palce to stay--for a great price!
A great stay
reviews.text: We really enjoyed our stay at the Balboa Park Inn. Its location was great and the roof garden was nice. The best part is that its walking distance to many sights.. the zoo, the park itself and some very nice restaurants. We also found it realistically priced for San Diego. I would recommend it !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: I booked Balboa Park based on previous TripAdvisor reviews. They weren't wrong. This is an excellent place. The room was a good size, bed was comfortable and all the staff were friendly and helpful. In fact the cleaner even found a necklace which we had left in our room on check out. The hotel provides some nice touches like daily newspaper delivered to your room. I have struggled to find anything negative to mention. However I've come up with some advice should you consider staying here.
reviews.title: A great accommodation choice. Would stay there again.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: - Breakfast -
reviews.title: We Love The Balboa Park Inn!!!

likes.liked: — Unique, comfortable, very clean, close to amusements and restaurants.
likes.disliked: — Cannot think of a single negative comment.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast is a choice of either cereals or croissants and buns. Both options come with fresh fruit. The croissants and buns are particular good, highly recommended. It is nice that they will deliver the breakfast to your room or outside terrace. However after about 3 or 4 days the options do become a bit repetitive.
reviews.title: So Fun!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: - Water pressure -
reviews.title: STILL Our Home Away From Home

likes.liked: — The location, the cleanliness and spaciousness of our our suite and the superb staff
likes.disliked: — I really can't think of anything I didn't like.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Recently returned from a trip for daughter's wedding to newly graduated Marine. Wasn't sure what to expect, but was very impressed with this quaint little inn. We stayed in the Las Palomas suite with great private balcony that overlooks Park Blvd and Balboa Park. It was very comfortable and we really enjoyed sitting on the balcony for the complimentary continental breakfast and our after dinner coffee. Staff provided us with solid recommendations for restaurants in area that were very reasonable (for San Diego). We would recommend this place to anyone who wants something different and doesn't need a luxury hotel where all the rooms look the same.
reviews.title: Special Secret Retreat
Love it and will be back
reviews.text: Came to San Diego on business and did not want to stay downtown.. Chose very well.. had a lovely suite (3 room) and loved the roof top lounge area.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: Internet: off and on which can be a problem since I was there on business but it wasn't that too much of a slow down/ did not bother me enough not to return next month
reviews.title: Clean, inexpensive, helpful staff
Baoa Park Inn- Fantastic - Love To Return Someday
reviews.text: Staff went out of their way for great customer service.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: My 4-year-old son and I stayed in the California Suite. It was a good size for us. It was essentially a very small apartment with a full kitchen (minus dishwasher), small dining room table, bedroom, and living room area. There was a tiny outdoor area too. Not really a deck, but sort of an enclosure. My son enjoyed running his trains and cars out there and I didn't have to worry about him because it's fenced from the street.
reviews.title: Right by the ZOO!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I highly recommend Balboa Park Inn.
reviews.title: Unique Getaway

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: One reviewer in October was horrified at the furnishing of the Greystoke Room. She should have seen Jungle Nook (#28) with its bronze gorilla perched over the jacuzzi, a jaguar by the breakfast nook, and a huge elephant head with tusks suspended over the bed. The assessment for this hotel/inn/motel (it defies description but the sign on the building says "unique bed and breakfast") is based primarily on Jungle Nook and a few observations on the management team.
reviews.title: "There's a jungle out there..."

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: But first of all, the location right near Balboa Park is excellent. You do not even need a car. Bus #7 can take you either to the zoo or to the Museum Place (one direction) or to Central Station (the other). Bus tickets are $2.25 general and $1.00 seniors. I have never found such friendly and helpful people as on the bus. Well done! If you elect to eat in the park, the Cohn Brothers' Prado restaurant is one of the best in town. The bar menu is served all day and will save you half the dinner fare. The restaurant itself, Mediterannean fare, will run $100 for two, with drinks and a full meal. Excellent variety from duck quesadillas to mushroom risotto.
reviews.title: great location, nice place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: So much has already been said about the quirkiness of the rooms but I need to mention specifically the lack of seating in Jungle Nook. There are no chairs in the bedroom. If you wish to sit, there is a table with two chairs in--get ready--the huge bathroom. This is a room with double shower and enormous jacuzzi tub. (Remember the lines "water, water, everywhere"?)
reviews.title: The small things made the difference...

likes.disliked: — Only the breakfast (not bad, but not superb either)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: To the side of this room is the breakfast table. You will be able to nibble at pastries and cereal while watching the two bath options outfitted with jaguar and gorilla. There is a separate bathroom with dual sinks and toilet (no chairs here but there is a hat rack, if you wish). Yes, you can have your breakfast outside and I would encourage you to do so if the weather is nice. You call to have breakfast brought to you, and you call when you wish your room to be serviced. There is NO window in the Jungle Nook, unless you count the tiny windows over the jacuzzi which can be opened only by scaling the tiles behind the tub.
reviews.title: Loved the themed room

likes.disliked: — The building work that was taking place in the room next door, the noise disturbed us in the morning.

reviews.title: Great location for a nice walk
reviews.text: I do need to mention that Paris in the 30's, at a far lower rate, is delightful and airy. Claustrophobes need not worry. But Sunday night there might be some major concern with the management team. We needed to phone the front desk Sunday night at 7:30 PM. There was no one. At 8:30 PM, still there was no one. Also, there is another major glitch. We were told that upon check-in, our credit card would be charged the full balance on the spot. We accepted this. But when we checked in, the charges had already been made and using the original card. Since I intended to use my credit card for the balance (my wife paid the first night's deposit), the management had to void the subsequent charge and credit her the balance and then charge on my card. Fortunately, the desk was charming and helpful despite all this. Our taxi was waiting for us promptly to take us back to the airport. Figure under $20 including tip each way from and to the airport. We managed to see quite a bit of the immediate area by taking local transport.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a small older hotel with kitchens or microwave/refridgerator and continental breakfast. We stayed in the Beach House and it is Miami beach designed. The pluses; big king size bed, big room, large bathroom with double size shower and jacuzzi tub. The place is dated and it shows. It was clean. The breakfast is just lots of carbohydrates and some fruit juice; some fruit or yogurt would have been nice. You make your own coffee in the room. The pillows were large and foamy. Location, Location. This place is in a safe neighborhood with free parking. It is next to Balboa park and the Hillcrest neighborhood where you can find every type of restaurant, Whole Foods, Ralphs, pharmacies, etc. Parking is free but you have to find it on the street. The room was quiet!!! The room had an old window heater/AC unit that ran/off all the time. The linens are dated. This is like staying at grandmas without grandma walking in.
reviews.title: Great neighborhood, like staying at grandmas

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Although cleanliness and location are important, these are the only two positives concerning our stay at the Balboa Park Inn.
reviews.title: Disappointing

likes.disliked: — room decor, breakfast, comfort, room temperature control, shower

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast? A few gummy muffins, juice - and not even a table at which to sit and eat them in the room.
reviews.title: Great value and location, friendly staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: Although we used the web the book the room, we were told there was no computer in the office and therefore we could not print our boarding passes. The restaurant recommended by the desk person was unappetizing; we did not eat there.
reviews.title: Wonderful stay at the Balboa Park Inn

likes.liked: — All of the extra touches that large hotel chains forget

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff tried to be helpful, but our experience was quite disappointing.
reviews.title: Funky, Fun and Unique
